storyInfo: Michael and Marion argue while Tippi and Moira reaffirm their friendship. A quiet night passes, but in the morning, the stagehand Hautin discovers the corpses of Michael and Marion on the set, suspended in mid-air.

attributes.content: Last night wasn't the first time Michael's come looking for you, was it?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: You haven't been in Wrankwood for long, and you're certainly not the type who would have meddled with something so far outside the scope your duties, if he hadn't been pestering you.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: He came to me the day after Dalton died and I took over the prop team.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: He wanted to leave without going through the normal process, and without anyone noticing.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Without, like, telling Miss Stone or going through the contract cancellation and exit procedures?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: But he's the lead actor. Someone was bound to find out, and he'd have to pay the contract penalty anyway.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Unless... something here scared him more than paying the penalty.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: He said since the prop team had access to all the tools and was familiar with the structure of the plate, he wondered if I could...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: If you could think of a way.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: I mean, I'm sure you could, but Michael's not done with his scenes yet. If he really got away and Miss Stone found out you helped him... she wouldn't let you off the hook easy.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: She could even end your career in Wrankwood!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: What would your sister think?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: My sister...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Didn't you say the rest of your family was against you coming to Wrankwood, and she's the only one who cheered you on?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: You have to make it, and not just to prove your family wrong.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I just don't want to disappoint my sister. I want her to be happy for me.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: S-So don't be mad, Tippi...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Please?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: I'm just mad that you were hiding stuff from me.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I know you'd never agree to Michael's demands. You just didn't know how to refuse him... I can help with that.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Alright, Tippi. I've never seen you so angry...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Sh-Should we watch a movie together?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: ...You want to sneak off the plate with me?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Yeah, babe. After we spend some quality time here, we can go and pack up right away.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Even if that prop girl really does find a way for you to circumvent the exit procedures... how do you expect to avoid the penalty for breaching your contract?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Shooting isn't over yet, and you know Greta. She'll make you pay an arm and a leg!
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Who cares about some stupid contract when there's a killer on the loose?!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Dalton's dead, Shelly's dead... how long do you think it'll be before you and I are next?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: We both watched and did nothing when Laura died five years ago.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Whether the killer is her lover, her dad, or some self-righteous vigilante, he's clearly after everyone who was involved!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: He wants us to repent and pay for what we did!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I can take you away from this awful place, babe. We have our whole future ahead of us.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Ha, how romantic of you.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: But since when has your love been so deep?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: So even when you were winking at Melanie, and flirting with Anna from stage design and Mila from logistics...
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: You're telling me you were seriously thinking about spending the rest of your life with me?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: D-Does that matter right now?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Of course it does—I'm not going, Michael.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: And neither are you.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: You know how hard it was to get you a lead role in one of Greta's films? And not just one, but three at once!
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Play this right, and you'll be a bona fide Wrankwood movie star!
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: There'll be another chance...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Look at me, Michael.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Your costume in The Death of Lady Dupont is even more exquisite and eye-catching than Melanie's, the title character.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Your perfume, what you wore to fashion week—I bought all of that with my own money. Even those fake ears and tail that let you pass as a Vulpo came from me...
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Without me, the public will find out that this 'Michael' product suddenly doesn't seem so shiny anymore.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: We've been together for five years. I gave up everything for you. I've spent so much of my savings, and I'm not getting any younger... I can't afford to wait for 'another chance'.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: I love you, Michael. So don't let me down.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: You... love me?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You were glad when Melanie publicly revealed our relationship the day Dalton died, weren't you?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: To everyone else, I'm the troublemaking playboy, while you're the poor, suffering girlfriend who gave everything only to get nothing in return but mockery.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: How very sympathetic, huh?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: And what part of that is a lie?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: You said it yourself: you're just investing in a product. Investment costs money.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You'd have invested in Dalton instead, wouldn't you, if he hadn't become a hopeless drunk?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You're just a parasite looking for a host, Marion.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: This is stupid... And I'm stupid too.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Well, I guess that's it for us. You can stay if you want—I'm outta here.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Oh, and here's a tip: if you're looking for your next investment, try that pretty boy Lucian. He caught the entire crew's attention his first time in front of a camera. He's the real deal.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The moment you walk out of here, I'm reporting you to Greta.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: You cold-hearted lunatic. Are you not afraid of the killer?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: And why should I be?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Five years ago, I didn't even know why Laura fell to her death until later.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: You're the one who watched and did nothing, not me.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: What are you looking at, Michael?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Rage overcomes the 'Vulpo' like a tidal wave. He sees a fire axe in a corner of the makeup room and clenches his fists.
Ah—
attributes.name: Tippi & Moira

attributes.content: Why would they go down into the power deck?! Sure, there were mannequins all over the surface, but there had to have been a better plan, right Molly?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I agree.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: There's nowhere to run from the Wraith in the tight spaces of a nomadic city's underground structure.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: In the end, it found them one by one and hung them from the ducts to await a slow death in the endless darkness...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: I went to one of the cast's interviews, and they said it was inspired by the rituals of certain Columbian wasteland tribes. Something about atonement and judgment...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Well, how they got there was kinda dumb, but I did like the segment in the power deck.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Because it was all shot on location!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Rumor has it that they ran out of cash, so they snuck into another film's studio plate and finished the shooting there... Exciting, right?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Wait... but I've seen this movie in theaters. Why don't I remember any of these scenes?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Because we're watching a copy of the original reel that was sent to the ratings agencies!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: How did you even get your hands on something like that?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: It's, like, a basic skill for a true horror fan!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: You're hiding something, Tippi...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: You know so much about the industry and all the ins-and-outs of Wrankwood. How does a background painter get so much insider knowledge?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: How can you do this to me, Molly?!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I share my super-secret treasure with you, hoping to make you happy, and all I get is an interrogation? *Sob*...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Aw, don't cry, I won't ask anymore, alright?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Let's just focus on the movie... so stop looking away from the screen!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Heh, you noticed.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Sorry, there's just been so much going on with the film crew lately, I'm... I'm a little nervous...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Don't worry, I'm here for you, girl!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: You sure are!
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Feeling better now?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Okay, listen up, Molly.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: No matter who I am, one thing's for sure: I'm your best friend on this crew.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: So if there's a killer on the loose, I'll protect you!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: And if work's not going well, we can do it together. We'll make our names as Wrankwood's golden horror duo, Tippi the spray-painter and Moira the prop-maker!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: And when we're really close, I'll take you to meet my family... Although I don't know if you'll be scared or surprised!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Then I'll introduce you to my sister too!
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: We'll share stories of Wrankwood while she peels us apples. She can peel one without breaking the skin in under half a minute! I know you'll love her!
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Now there's an offer I can't refuse!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: The old TV lights up both the darkened room and their faces. Terrifying sounds echo throughout, but take nothing away from their smiles.
They cuddle up against one another, fighting their fear with a much more familiar 'fear', and dreaming of the future of their budding friendship.
It is a rare, quiet evening.
Why is the set so dark?
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: *Sigh* I should've asked Moira. She's always here early, and she knows where all the switches are.
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: The prop room isn't that far, is it? Have I been going around in circles? ...Something doesn't seem right.
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: Huh? Am I hearing things?
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: The sound of water dripping echoes through the empty set as though answering Hautin's question, but such 'response' serves only to increase her confusion and fear.
She knows there are no water pipes above her, but the sound she is hearing is definitely coming from nearby.
Wh-Who's there?!
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: Is this another one of those stupid pranks you'll laugh at me over drinks after work for?
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: C-Come out now and I won't hold it against you! Or don't tell me Moira's in on it too? She's just a kid, how could you make her—
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: Ouch—
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: Hautin falls backwards to the ground. Only then does she realize that she is wearing a flashlight on her belt. But she barely has time to laugh at herself before she smells a strong, sweet scent accompanied by a tang of iron.
Frightened, she stands up and turns on her flashlight—
A breeze sways the ropes. Hanging down from them are two familiar and strangely quiet figures.
The two lovers, Michael and Marion, subject of much of the crew's gossip, have met their deaths with their backs against each other.
Through the faint light, Hautin sees their faces, their expressions, the way they sway through the air, and the dancing specks of dust...
It is indescribably eerie, and somehow... sacred.
She remembers what Tippi said when she joined one of her movie sessions...
In the rituals of certain Columbian wasteland tribes, hanging represents both judgment of the dead, and a warning for the living.
Until the scorching sun cracks their corpses open, until all believe they deserved their punishment, until the ropes can no longer bear the weight of their sin—
Thump.
H-Help! Somebody! Anybody!
attributes.name: Unlucky Stagehand

attributes.content: The unlucky stagehand runs outside. As she does, a thought flashes through her mind—
What an absurd morning.
